p: The strong GTP and long lifetime of N 2O makes it the largest and most lasting contributor to global warming in China. Agriculture is responsible for about 80% of the climate warming effect of N 2O. The high N fertilizer input and low N use efficiency in China's agricultural fields are responsible for the increasing N 2O emissions 27. Our scenario analysis shows that a larger mitigation potential for climate change could be realized through improving N use efficiency to reduce agricultural N 2O emissions. Many approaches can be taken to enhance N use efficiency, for example, systematic crop rotation, wise use of fertilizer, and expanded use of nitrification inhibitors 28. Although the agricultural activities are the largest contributor, emission of N 2O from chemical industries also shows a large increase potential; and the control options are the most-effective in this sector 10. Hence, the all-around measures to reduce N 2O emission from agriculture and industry could lead to the co-benefits of climate mitigation and positive environmental effect through protecting ozone layer.
